thread.title: Shakey’s Reinforced Conference on today
thread.title_full: Shakey’s Reinforced Conference on today | mb.com.ph | Philippine News

author: Kristel Satumbaga
title: Shakey’s Reinforced Conference on today
text:
by Kristel Satumbaga
October 10, 2015 Games Today
(The Arena, San Juan)
12:45 p.m. – Navy vs UP (V-League)
3 p.m. – Air Force vs IEM (Spikers’ Turf)
5 p.m. – Navy vs Sta. Elena (Spikers’ Turf)
Buoyed by the success of the Collegiate Conference which ended just a week ago, Shakey’s V-League is hoping to end its season with a bang when it stages the Reinforced Conference starting today at The Arena in San Juan.
University of the Philippines and Philippine Navy take the honor of raising the curtain of the country’s premier volleyball league when they clash at 12:45 p.m. with both teams out to start their bids in grand fashion.
While the tournament attracted only six teams, the Lady Maroons are confident they will learn valuable lessons playing against teams with seasoned players.
The short tournament is part of UP’s massive preparation for the UAAP competition starting in February next year.
It will likewise test whether UP’s Kathy Bersola has already recovered from anterior cruciate ligament (ACL) injury which she sustained in last season’s UAAP.
Aside from Bersola, also expected to deliver for the Lady Maroons are Nicole Tiamzon, Maris Layug, Justine Dorog, Isa Molde and Diana Carlos.
While focus will be on Tiamzon and Bersola, UP Coach Jerry Yee will be giving Layug, Dorog, Molde and Carlos more time on the court to boost their confidence.
The Lady Maroons also took part in the Collegiate Conference but were eliminated early.
Meanwhile, Sta. Elena Construction and Development Corp. hopes to make an impact right on its first crack in the Spikers’ Turf as it slugs it out with Navy even as Air Force collides with Instituto Estetico Manila at the start of the Reinforced Conference.
Aces from former Champion Infinity squad make up the top realty and construction firm’s roster, including San Beda’s Sylvester Honrade, Perpetual Help’s Joven Camaganakan, St. Benilde’s Angelo Espiritu, La Salle’s Mark Lee, Michael Antonio and Al-Frazin Abdulwahab along with Rhenze Hu, Roland Tonquin, Anjo Banaga and Richard Gomez.
But they will be up against a Navy squad also out to gain early momentum in the season-ending conference of the country’s premier men’s volley tournament presented by PLDT Home Ultera and backed by Mikasa.
